Authors: Hartono S., Saputra C.G.K., Sari N.
Title: Evaluation of enterprise resource planning system based on SAP module of material management procurement function in PT. Kimia farma tbk
Source title: International Journal of Recent Technology and Engineering
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hartono, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Saputra, C.G.K., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sari, N., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to evaluate and analyze solutions for problems that identified in the Enterprise Resource Planning SAP based on system Material Management Module on Procurement Function in PT. Kimia Farma Tbk. The evaluation method is fit gap analysis Architectural Approach based on FURPS System Requirement model. The Procurement processes included in this study are Create Purchase Requisition, Create Request for Quotation, Maintain Quotation, Create Purchase Order, Create Goods Receipt and Create Service Entry Sheet. The results in this study are presented as a recommendation to fix the problem based on the evaluation result. © BEIESP.
Author Keywords: Architectural Approach; Enterprise Resource Planning; Evaluation; Fit Gap Analysis; FURPS; Procurement; SAP

Authors: Widuri R., Sari N., Wicaksono A., Sun Y., Sari S.A.
Title: Perception of internal auditor on the use of Generalized Audit Software
Source title: International Conference on Research and Innovation in Information Systems, ICRIIS
Affiliations: Faculty of Economic and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; School of Business and Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Widuri, R., Faculty of Economic and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sari, N., Faculty of Economic and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Wicaksono, A., Faculty of Economic and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sun, Y., Faculty of Economic and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sari, S.A., School of Business and Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The objective of this research is to explore the perception of internal auditor in public companies on the use of Generalized Audit Software (GAS) to improve the transparency and accountability of financial report. Qualitative approach was used by conducting face-to-face semi structured interview with internal auditors from Indonesian public companies. This research uses Agency Theory and Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) as underpinning theories, therefore this research provides academic contribution not only in auditing area but also in information technology. The results indicated that not all participants agreed that GAS is helping them in producing a transparent and accountable financial report. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Agency theory; GAS; IDX; Internal auditor; TAM
Index Keywords: Gallium; Information systems; Agency theory; Face to face; Financial reports; Internal auditor; Public company; Qualitative approach; Semi structured interviews; Technology acceptance model; Metadata
